body:
# bamboozled-cr

Bamboozled-cr is a Crystal port of the Ruby wrapper [Bamboozled](https://github.com/method-inc/bamboozled).

Both are an HTTP Client library for the [BambooHR API](https://documentation.bamboohr.com/docs).

## Installation

1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`:

```yml
dependencies:
  bamboozled:
    github: mdwagner/bamboozled-cr
```

2. Run `shards install`

## Usage

```crystal
require "bamboozled"

client = Bamboozled.client("my-subdomain", "my-api-key")

client.employee.photo_url("email@example.com")
# => http://my-subdomain.bamboohr.com/employees/photos?h=ba9bb45673e99e6fad7251bf8ea40f89
```

Please checkout the `spec/bamboozled/api` directory for more examples.

Also, checkout the [Ruby wrapper usage](https://github.com/Skookum/bamboozled#usage) as well.

## Documentation

Every push to `master` deploys the latest documentation to [GitHub Pages](https://mdwagner.github.io/bamboozled-cr/)

## Contributing

1. Fork it (<https://github.com/mdwagner/bamboozled-cr/fork>)
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`)
5. Create a new Pull Request

## Contributors

- [Michael Wagner](https://github.com/mdwagner) - creator and maintainer

types.name: Bamboozled
types.doc:
Implement endpoints for Bamboo HR's Applicant Tracking System
https://www.bamboohr.com/api/documentation/ats.php
types.summary: Implement endpoints for Bamboo HR's Applicant Tracking System https://www.bamboohr.com/api/documentation/ats.php

class_methods.name: client
class_methods.doc: Creates a standard client that will raise all errors it encounters
class_methods.summary: Creates a standard client that will raise all errors it encounters

instance_methods.name: add_comment
instance_methods.doc: Add comments to an application -- POST /applications/:id/comments

instance_methods.name: application
instance_methods.doc: Get the details of an application -- GET /applications/:id
instance_methods.summary: Get the details of an application -- GET /applications/:id

instance_methods.name: applications
instance_methods.doc: Get a list of applications, following pagination -- GET /applications
instance_methods.summary: Get a list of applications, following pagination -- GET /applications

def.name: applications
def.body:
apps = [] of JSON::Any
response = Response.new(headers: HTTP::Headers.new)
1.upto(page_limit) do |i|
  params = {"page" => "#{i}", "sortBy" => "created_date", "sortOrder" => "ASC"}
  if param_filters
    params.merge!(param_filters)
  end
  query_params = URI::Params.encode(params)
  res = request(:get, "applicant_tracking/applications", query_params: query_params)
  response = response.copy_with(headers: res.headers, json: res.json)
  if response.json.nil?
  else
    json = response.json.not_nil!
    if json["applications"]?
      json["applications"].as_a.each do |app|
        apps << app
      end
    end
    if json["paginationComplete"]?.try(&.as_bool)
      break
    end
  end
end
response.copy_with(json: JSON::Any.new(apps))

instance_methods.name: job_summaries
instance_methods.doc: Get a list of job summaries -- GET /jobs
instance_methods.summary: Get a list of job summaries -- GET /jobs

def.name: job_summaries
def.body:
params = {"statusGroups" => "ALL", "sortBy" => "created", "sortOrder" => "ASC"}
if param_filters
  params.merge!(param_filters)
end
query_params = URI::Params.encode(params)
request(:get, "applicant_tracking/jobs", query_params: query_params)

instance_methods.name: statuses
instance_methods.doc: Get a list of statuses for a company -- GET /statuses
instance_methods.summary: Get a list of statuses for a company -- GET /statuses

def.name: all
def.body:
employees = [] of JSON::Any
response = request(:get, "employees/directory")
response.json.try do |json|
  employees = json["employees"].as_a
  if fields.empty?
  else
    employees = employees.map do |employee|
      fields << "id"
      JSON::Any.new(employee.as_h.select(fields))
    end
  end
end
response.copy_with(json: JSON::Any.new(employees))

instance_methods.name: find
instance_methods.args_string: (employee_id, fields = ["firstName", "lastName"] of ::String)
instance_methods.args_html: (employee_id, fields = ["firstName", "lastName"] of ::String)

def.name: find
def.body:
query_params = URI::Params.encode({"fields" => fields.join(",")})
request(:get, "employees/#{employee_id}", query_params: query_params)

def.name: last_changed
def.body:
params = {"since" => time.to_s("%FT%T%:z")}
if type
  params["type"] = type
end
query_params = URI::Params.encode(params)
request(:get, "employees/changed", query_params: query_params)

def.name: photo_url
def.body:
uri = URI.new(scheme: "http", host: "#{subdomain}.bamboohr.com", path: "employees/photos", query: URI::Params.encode({"h" => (Digest::MD5.digest(email.strip.downcase)).hexstring}))
if tls
  uri.scheme = "https"
end
uri.to_s

def.name: time_off_estimate
def.body:
query_params = URI::Params.encode({"end" => end_date.to_s("%F")})
request(:get, "employees/#{employee_id}/time_off/calculations", query_params: query_params)

def.name: tables
def.body:
response = request(:get, "meta/tables")
res = response.json.try do |x|
  x["table"].as_a
end || ([] of JSON::Any)
response.copy_with(json: JSON::Any.new(res))

def.name: users
def.body:
response = request(:get, "meta/users")
res = response.json.try do |__arg0|
  __arg0.as_h.values
end || ([] of JSON::Any)
response.copy_with(json: JSON::Any.new(res))

def.name: custom
def.body:
query_params = URI::Params.encode({"format" => "JSON"})
body = {"fields" => fields.join(",")}.to_json
request(:post, "reports/custom", query_params: query_params, body: body)

def.name: find
def.body:
params = {"format" => "JSON"}
if disable_dup_filtering
  params["fd"] = "no"
end
query_params = URI::Params.encode(params)
request(:get, "reports/#{id}", query_params: query_params)

instance_methods.name: requests
instance_methods.args_string: (start start_date : Time, end end_date : Time, id = nil, action = "view", employee_id = nil, type = nil, status = nil)
instance_methods.args_html: (start start_date : Time, end end_date : Time, id = nil, action = "view", employee_id = nil, type = nil, status = nil)

def.name: requests
def.body:
params = {"action" => action, "start" => start_date.to_s("%F"), "end" => end_date.to_s("%F")}
if id
  params["id"] = id.to_s
end
if employee_id
  params["employeeId"] = employee_id.to_s
end
if type
  params["type"] = type.to_s
end
params["status"] = status.try(&.to_s) || (["approved", "denied", "superceded", "requested", "canceled"] of ::String)
query_params = URI::Params.encode(params)
request(:get, "time_off/requests", query_params: query_params)

def.name: whos_out
def.body:
params = {} of String => String
if start_date
  params["start"] = start_date.to_s("%F")
end
if valid_end_date?(start_date, end_date)
  params["end"] = end_date.to_s("%F")
end
query_params = URI::Params.encode(params)
request(:get, "time_off/whos_out", query_params: query_params)

def.name: adjust
def.body:
body = {"timeTrackingId" => time_tracking_id, "hoursWorked" => hours_worked}.to_json
request(:put, "timetracking/adjust", body: body)

def.name: name
def.body:
(case self
when .get?
  "GET"
when .post?
  "POST"
when .put?
  "PUT"
when .delete?
  "DELETE"
end).not_nil!
